title: What are the legalities of putting short samples of dialogue from films on a CD? - Quora

response.answer_text: Generally to be able to do this requires doing so under the ‘fair use’ doctrine, which loosely means you can quote or excerpt from movies, tv, etc for the purpose of commenting on them (as journalists do) but not to just show clips you want. Otherwise you’re best to ask permission from the copyright owners. I’ve done it, you might be surprised how often they say yes.

If done without permission, this would be copyright infringement. Multiple counts, one for each quote. And multiply that by the number of copies you distribute. This would be one hell of a lawsuit which you could not win. Be aware: movie trivia games that use quotes get a license to do this from the distributors of the film. They have permission, which is the only way to do this legally.
